group_1.narration: If I could keep this job without any problems...
And stay together with my loving parents@and my cute little brothers and sister...
I'm sure our modest household@will still fall on hard times,@but we'll be able to laugh together@and live happily as a family.
Then, as promised,@I'd go see her play.
I'd tell her that I love her work,@while hiding my embarrassment with a light bit of teasing.
I'd tell her that@she's going to be a big-name playwright someday,@and joke that she should introduce me to some celebrities@when that time comes...
If I'm going to live for my family,@I may not spend as much time there as I used to.
But we'd still get together every once in a while@and spend time laughing over silly things.
That's my current idea of happiness.

group_1.textCenter: (At worst, my family could be separated.)
(I'd lose my friends, my family, everything...)

group_1.textRight: Are you ready to make a contract with me?
If you want to fix your situation,@I can make it happen.

group_1.textLeft: ...I don't really trust you.
But...

group_1.textCenter: It's about time you get out of our house.

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Kyubey.
At this point, I don't care what you are, as long@as you can really help me out of this situation.
I'll put my faith in anything, whether it's@God or the devil.
If you can do it, grant my wish...!
(The poor aren't treated with respect...)
(The mask I wore to avoid that was@all too fragile.)
(So...let's start over again.)
Kyubey!

group_1.narration: "I want everyone at school to believe that@I'm the daughter of a respectable family!"

group_1.textLeft: Oh my, what's the matter, Miss Kirino?
You can make it tomorrow...right?

group_1.textRight: What...? I thought I got fired...

group_1.textLeft: Oh heavens no, of course not!
Empty classroom...? What are you@talking about?
You're from a respectable family,@so you're trustworthy.
And you're well-known for being@an honor student at school.
It's an honor to have you as a tutor.
Yes, I'll be counting on you! Kirino-senpai!

group_1.textRight: (They're acting like the incident with the@empty classroom never happened...?)
(Could the wish really have come true...?!)

group_1.textLeft: Wishes being granted...@It's the realm of fantasy...

group_1.textRight: That's what I've been telling you@since the beginning.
Now, getting right to it, Magical Girlsâ€”

group_1.textLeft: Hey, can we save that for tomorrow?@I have some urgent business to attend.

group_1.textRight: ...Well then, I'll give you the explanation later.

group_1.narration: My wish only changed the perception of me at school...
Thus,@my family's financial situation remains precarious,@and probably always will be.
However,@this will keep my family together for a while...
I became something I don't really understand,@a Magical Girl...
But still,@I was able to protect my precious family.
